full_summary:
# Invitation for Qualification
## Reference Number

* 5P468-23-0132/A
* cb-7353-10442660

## Notice of Amendment

* 1st amendment made on August 3, 2023

## Advisory Description
Parks Canada invites interested suppliers to submit an Invitation to Qualify, a two-stage selection process for the decommissioning and reinstatement of three coastal parking and lookout areas at Prince Edward Island National Park. The sites suffered significant damage due to the extreme weather conditions brought by Hurricane Fiona in September 2022.

## Scope of Work
The selected supplier will be responsible for:
* Decommissioning and removal of the three damaged parking and lookout areas
* Preparing the sites for further reconstruction

## Value of Contract
The estimated total contract value is between $100,001 and $250,000 (GST extra).

## Duration of Contract

* The contractor has a maximum of 6 weeks to complete the work after contract award.

## Request for Site Visit
 Suppliers are encouraged to participate in a site visit on July 26, 2023, at 1794 Terre Rouge Ln, North Rustico, PE, to gain a better understanding of the project requirements.

## Process for Submissions

* Suppliers must submit an Invitation to Qualify document with relevant qualifications and experience.
* The selections will be based on the supplier's scope of work, equipment, and experience.

## Important Dates

* Notice of Amendment (1): August 3, 2023
* Closing Date of the Invitation to Qualify: August 3, 2023, at 2:00 PM (ADT)
* Date of Site Visit: July 26, 2023

## Contact Information
 Annik Piché
 annik.piche@pc.gc.ca
 Phone: (581) 398-3489
 Fax: (855) 983-1808

## Information and Requirements
 Suppliers are required to submit a comprehensive bid as per the solicitation document. Suppliers must also ensure they meet all the requirements and regulations specified in the bid solicitation document.

Note: Links to attachments, bid documents, and relevant tendering information are available on the Canadabuys website. Please note that the information provided is subject to change and may not be comprehensive. Suppliers are advised to review the bid solicitation document in its entirety for more details.
